title: Bug: DecayAnalyzer.scan() uses storage.memories but JSONLStorage has _memories
description: DecayAnalyzer.scan() at line 117 accesses self.storage.memories but JSONLStorage stores memories in private _memories dict. Need to use list_memories() method or add public property. Discovered during Phase 8 CLI testing.

title: Implement multi-agent memory consolidation via Beads
description:
## Overview

Implement the multi-agent memory consolidation architecture using Beads as an orchestration layer for CortexGraph memory maintenance.

## Research Location

Full design documentation in `research/beads-integration/`:
- `README.md` - Executive summary
- `multi-agent-consolidation.md` - Detailed architecture with code examples
- `integration-opportunities.md` - Additional integration patterns
- `technology-stack.md` - Beads technology analysis
- `beads-architecture.md` - Beads internals deep dive

## Architecture Summary

Five specialized agents coordinate via Beads issues:

1. **Decay Analyzer** - Find memories in danger zone (0.15-0.35 score)
2. **Cluster Detector** - Group similar memories for consolidation
3. **Semantic Merge** - Intelligently merge clustered memories
4. **LTM Promoter** - Decide which memories to promote to Obsidian vault
5. **Relationship Discovery** - Find cross-domain connections

Agents pass work via Beads issues with `discovered-from` dependencies for provenance.

## Key Benefits

- Parallelization (multiple agents work simultaneously)
- Full audit trail via dependency chains
- Graceful degradation (queue persists if agent fails)
- Human override capability
- Natural scheduling via `bd ready`

## Implementation Steps

### Phase 1: Foundation
- [ ] Add `beads_issue_ids` field to Memory model
- [ ] Create MCP tool for agent-Beads coordination
- [ ] Set up issue templates for each agent type

### Phase 2: Decay Analyzer (Start Here)
- [ ] Implement danger zone memory scanner
- [ ] Create Beads issues with memory context in notes
- [ ] Test with real CortexGraph data

### Phase 3: Cluster & Merge Agents
- [ ] Cluster Detector picks up decay-flagged memories
- [ ] Semantic Merge processes consolidation queue
- [ ] Link issues with discovered-from dependencies

### Phase 4: Promotion & Relations
- [ ] LTM Promoter evaluates merged memories
- [ ] Relationship Discovery finds cross-domain links
- [ ] Full pipeline integration test

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Decay Analyzer creates valid Beads issues from CortexGraph queries
- [ ] Dependency chains correctly track analysis provenance
- [ ] Consolidated memories have proper audit trail
- [ ] Multiple agents can work in parallel without conflicts
- [ ] Human can inspect and override any decision via Beads UI

## Related

- Beads repository: https://github.com/steveyegge/beads
- CortexGraph consolidation: `src/cortexgraph/core/consolidation.py`
- Natural spaced repetition: `src/cortexgraph/core/review.py`
